s.text: The New York Times leads with new Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit to troops fighting in Chechnya, a story run above the fold in the Los Angeles Times and on Page A17 in the Washington Post . The Post and LAT lead with pieces on Y2K computer glitches--or rather the lack thereof--a story fronted by the NYT (technically, the Post story is part of a Y2K package serving as the top non-local lead).

A combination of jingoism among political elites and insularity among the business elites who spearheaded this new international commerce provoked a near-50-year reaction against free trade and global communications.
